articles.title: Islamic State claims attack on international airport and airbase in Niger
articles.snippet:
Motorcycle-riding militants launch strikes using heavy weaponry and drones, damaging planes belonging to Ivorian carrier and Togolese airline
Islamic State in the Sahel has claimed responsibility for an audacious assault at the international airport and adjacent air force base in Niamey, the capital of Niger, according to the SITE Intelligence Group, which tracks jihadist activity and communications worldwide.
The attack, which began shortly after midnight on Thursday, reportedly involved motorcycle-riding militants who launched a “surprise and coordinated” strike using heavy weaponry and drones, according to statements released via IS in the Sahel’s propaganda arm, Amaq news agency.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: イスラム国、ニジェールの国際空港と空軍基地への攻撃を主張

articles.title: South Africa expels top Israeli diplomat over ‘insulting attacks’ on president
articles.snippet:
Ariel Seidman declared persona non grata and given 72 hours to leave country after remarks on social media
South Africa and Israel have engaged in a tit-for-tat expulsion of senior diplomats, after South Africa ordered Israel’s chargé d’affaires to leave within 72 hours, citing “insulting attacks” on South Africa’s president, Cyril Ramaphosa, on social media.
Ariel Seidman, the chargé d’affaires at Israel’s embassy in Pretoria, was declared persona non grata by South Africa’s department for international relations and cooperation (DIRCO) in a statement on its website on Friday afternoon.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: 南アフリカ、大統領への「侮辱的な攻撃」を理由にイスラエルの上級外交官を追放

articles.title: Niger’s military ruler vows retaliation after gunfire and explosions heard in capital
articles.snippet:
General Tchiani accuses France, Benin and the Ivory Coast of links to attack near Niamey’s airport and thanks Russian troops for defence efforts 
 
Heavy security has been deployed around the main airport in Niger’s capital, Niamey, after overnight gunfire and explosions that the country’s military ruler blamed without evidence on France, Benin and Côte d’Ivoire.
The shooting and detonations began shortly after midnight on Wednesday, according to residents of a neighbourhood near the airport, which is next to Base Aérienne 101, a military base previously used by US and then Russian troops.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: ニジェールの軍事支配者、首都で銃声と爆発が聞こえた後、報復を誓う

articles.title: Hundreds feared dead in attempt to cross Mediterranean during cyclone
articles.snippet:
Fifty killed in one incident as Italian authorities estimate 380 people may have drowned last week
Up to 380 people may have drowned attempting to cross the Mediterranean last week as Cyclone Harry battered southern Italy and Malta, the Italian coastguard has said, as a shipwreck with the loss of 50 lives was confirmed by Maltese authorities.
Just one person, who was hospitalised in Malta, survived the shipwreck, which happened on Friday.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: サイクロン中に地中海横断を試み、数百人が死亡と懸念

articles.title: Crocodile warnings as floods devastate southern Africa
articles.snippet:
More than 100 people killed and hundreds of thousands displaced in South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe
Devastating floods have killed more than 100 people in southern Africa since the beginning of the year and displaced hundreds of thousands, as authorities and aid workers warn of hunger, cholera and attacks by crocodiles that have spread with the waters.
More than 70 people have died in Zimbabwe and 30 in South Africa, where hundreds of people were evacuated from Kruger national park earlier this month after a deluge of rain.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: 洪水が南部アフリカを壊滅させ、ワニの警告

articles.title: Mexico’s president says Trump’s tariffs on Cuba’s oil suppliers could trigger humanitarian crisis
articles.snippet:
Island country only has oil enough to last 15-20 days, and 12-hour blackouts have become commonplace
Mexico’s president, Claudia Sheinbaum, has warned that Donald Trump’s move to slap new tariffs on countries sending oil to Cuba could trigger a humanitarian crisis on the island, which is already suffering from chronic fuel shortages and regular blackouts.
The US president signed an executive order on Thursday declaring a national emergency and laying the groundwork for such tariffs, ratcheting up the pressure to topple the communist government in Havana.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: メキシコ大統領、トランプ氏のキューバ石油供給国への関税は人道危機を引き起こす可能性があると警告

articles.title: Panama supreme court cancels Hong Kong company’s canal contracts
articles.snippet:
Panama’s president says strategic waterway will operate as normal after ruling that advances US policy aims
Panama’s president said ports at each end of the Panama canal would operate as usual after the country’s supreme court ruled the concession held by a subsidiary of a Chinese company was unconstitutional.
The court’s decision on Thursday, which helps US attempts to block any Chinese influence over the strategic waterway, immediately drew a sharp rebuke from Beijing.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: パナマ最高裁、香港企業の運河契約を破棄

articles.title: Venezuela approves bill to open oil sector to foreign investment after US pressure
articles.snippet:
Law will give private companies more control but experts unsure whether changes go far enough for US
Venezuela’s acting president has signed into law a bill making significant changes to the country’s oil sector after pressure from the US to open it up to foreign private investment.
The new hydrocarbons law promises to give private companies control over oil production and sales, ease taxes and allow for independent arbitration of disputes, while largely maintaining state control over oil production.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラ、米国の圧力後、石油部門を外国投資に開放する法案を承認

articles.title: Weather tracker: Winter storms cause death and outages across eastern north America
articles.snippet:
Millions told to stay home in US and more than a million are left without power, while Australia faces record heatwave
Cold weather across a vast swathe of the eastern US has been the likely cause of at least 49 deaths in the past week.
At one point, about 213 million people were under some sort of winter weather warnings, affecting areas from New Mexico to New England – a spread of about 2,000 miles (3,200km). Millions were told to stay at home, and at one point there were more than a million people without power. As of Wednesday night, there were still 312,000 outages, mostly across Tennessee, Mississippi, Louisiana and Texas.
 Continue reading...
articles.titleJa: 天候追跡：冬の嵐が北米東部で死者と停電を引き起こす

articles.title: Trump threatens tariffs on goods from countries that sell oil to Cuba
articles.snippet:
White House cites Cuba’s ties to hostile powers as order ratchets up Trump’s pressure to topple its government
Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday laying the groundwork to slap tariffs on goods from countries that provide oil to Cuba, the White House said.
The order, which ratchets up Trump’s pressure to topple the communist government, declares a national emergency and establishes a process for the US secretaries of state and commerce to assess tariffs against countries that sell or otherwise provide oil to the island nation. The White House has yet to specify tariff rates for violating its new policy of blocking Cuba from buying oil.
 Continue reading...

articles.snippet: Scientists think that Svalbard bears have adapted to recent ice loss by eating more land-based prey.
articles.titleJa: ノルウェーの島々のホッキョクグマ、氷の減少にもかかわらず肥満で健康、科学者らが発表

articles.title: Deutsche Bank offices raided in money laundering probe
articles.snippet: Officials searched offices in Frankfurt and Berlin in relation to "past business relationships".
articles.titleJa: ドイツ銀行のオフィスがマネーロンダリング捜査で家宅捜索

articles.title: Panic on crowded Ukraine train - passenger describes moment of Russian drone strike
articles.snippet: The BBC speaks to a person who was aboard a train on which five people died after it was targeted by drones.
articles.titleJa: 混雑したウクライナの列車でのパニック - 乗客がロシアのドローン攻撃の瞬間を語る

articles.title: Europe must act urgently and stop outsourcing defence, says EU's Kallas
articles.snippet: The EU foreign policy chief's remarks come days after Nato's secretary general said Europe needed the US for its defence.
articles.titleJa: EUのカラス氏、欧州は緊急に行動し防衛のアウトソーシングをやめるべきだと発言

articles.title: At least five killed after Storm Kristin hits Portugal
articles.snippet: The storm toppled trees, damaged homes and left more than 800,000 people without power.
articles.titleJa: 暴風雨クリスティンがポルトガルを襲い、少なくとも5人が死亡

articles.title: Trubin's 'miracle' - how Mourinho's Benfica stunned Real Madrid
articles.snippet: Goalkeeper Anatoly Trubin's header gives Jose Mourinho an unforgettable moment as Benfica beat Real Madrid to stay alive in the Champions League.
articles.titleJa: トゥルビンの「奇跡」 - モウリーニョ率いるベンフィカがレアル・マドリードを驚かせた方法

articles.title: India and EU announce 'mother of all trade deals'
articles.snippet: The long-awaited deal comes as both Delhi and Brussels contend with economic and geopolitical pressure from the US.
articles.titleJa: インドとEUが「史上最大の貿易協定」を発表

articles.title: Venezuelan MPs approve bill to open up oil sector to private firms
articles.snippet: The change could pave the way for more foreign investment in the country's oil industry.
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラ議会、石油部門の民間企業への開放法案を承認

articles.title: Plane crashes in Colombia, killing all 15 on board
articles.snippet: State ariline Satena says its aircraft carrying 13 passengers and two crew "suffered a fatal accident".
articles.titleJa: コロンビアで飛行機墜落、乗員乗客15人全員死亡

articles.title: Ecuador says ICE agent attempted to enter its Minneapolis consulate
articles.snippet: A complaint has been filed by Ecuador, whose consular staff prevented the agent from entering.
articles.titleJa: エクアドル、ICE捜査官がミネアポリス総領事館への侵入を試みたと発表

articles.title: Mexico president asks South Korea for more BTS concerts
articles.snippet: About a million fans were vying for 150,000 concert tickets, which sold out in less than 40 minutes.
articles.titleJa: メキシコ大統領、韓国にBTSの追加公演を要請

articles.title: Families sue US over deadly boat strike off Venezuela coast
articles.snippet: Relatives of Chad Joseph and Rishi Samaroo - among six killed on 14 October - say the Trinidadian men were returning home when their vessel was hit.
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラ沖でのボート衝突事故を巡り、遺族が米国を提訴

articles.title: Gunmen storm Mexico football pitch and kill at least 11 people
articles.snippet: The incident happened in Salamanca, a city particularly subject to gang-related violence.
articles.titleJa: メキシコのサッカー場で武装集団が襲撃、少なくとも11人死亡

articles.title: Sly Dunbar, prolific legend of reggae, dies aged 73
articles.snippet: The drummer and producer played with everyone from Bob Marley to The Rolling Stones and Madonna.
articles.titleJa: レゲエの伝説的ドラマー、スライ・ダンバーが73歳で死去

articles.title: Son-in-law of Venezuelan opposition candidate freed from jail, wife says
articles.snippet: Rafael Tudares was arrested after his father-in-law, Edmundo González, ran against Nicolás Maduro in the election.
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラの野党候補の義理の息子が釈放されたと妻が語る

articles.title: Venezuelan Nobel Peace Prize winner presents her medal to Trump

articles.titleJa: ベネズエラのノーベル平和賞受賞者、メダルをトランプ氏に贈呈

articles.title: Machado vows to lead Venezuela 'when right time comes'
articles.snippet: The opposition leader says she has a mandate to lead the country after the US seized its president.
articles.titleJa: マチャド氏、好機が来たらベネズエラを率いると誓う

articles.title: Venezuela inflates release figures as political prisoners remain in limbo
articles.snippet: As Venezuelan authorities claim a mass release of political prisoners, families wait outside detention centers without answers, or guarantees. Behind the government’s discourse of reconciliation, uncertainty and fear persist.
articles.titleJa: ベネズエラ、政治犯が宙に浮いたまま釈放数を水増し

articles.title: The peacemakers: Meet Venezuelans who are fighting to free political detainees
articles.snippet: In Venezuela, relatives and human-rights NGOs have stepped up calls for the immediate release of more than 800 victims of politically-motivated persecution of the government formerly led by Nicolás Maduro.
articles.titleJa: 平和の使者たち：政治犯の解放を求めて闘うベネズエラ人たちに会う

articles.title: Venezuela after Maduro: Leadership of the South American nation seems uncertain
articles.snippet: Since the airstrikes, there has been a huge sense of uncertainty, with long queues in local supermarkets and gas stations, and Caracas residents worried about basic necessities like groceries.
articles.titleJa: マドゥーロ後のベネズエラ：南米国家の指導者の座は不透明に

articles.title: A new, terrifying sound: A Venezuelan account of the the attack on Caracas
articles.snippet: “I thought Venezuelans had already heard every sound the country’s violence had to offer. But this was something new — terrifying in its unfamiliarity.”
articles.titleJa: 新たな、恐ろしい音：カラカス攻撃に関するベネズエラ人の証言

articles.title: ‘Clean up your culture’: a TV host’s comment makes Indigenous Brazilians speak up
articles.snippet: “Access to technology should be a guaranteed right to the all Brazilian citizens. To have a cell phone doesn't make (anyone) less Indigenous.”
articles.titleJa: 「文化をきれいにしろ」：テレビ司会者の発言がブラジルの先住民族に声を上げさせる

articles.title: Dominican Republic wastes renewable energy while fossil fuel thermoelectric plants operate above legal limits
articles.snippet: Non-compliance with Technical Minimum Power, causing a greater injection of fossil-fuel-generated energy into the grid, violates Dominican legislation and hinders climate commitments, especially when renewable energy companies’ production remains restricted.
articles.titleJa: ドミニカ共和国、再生可能エネルギーを無駄にする一方で化石燃料火力発電所が法的制限を超えて稼働

articles.title: Social networks fuel youth mobilization on Argentina’s streets
articles.snippet: Unlike movements in earlier decades, Argentina’s latest youth-led protests are increasingly organized digitally through platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and Whatsapp, rather than through unions or political parties.
articles.titleJa: ソーシャルネットワークがアルゼンチンの街頭での若者の動員を加速

articles.title: Life at the U.S.–Mexico border under the Trump administration
articles.snippet: The Trump administration has reintroduced some of its most contentious border measures, leading to renewed targeting, detention, and deportation of migrant communities, leaving thousands seeking safety in increasingly perilous conditions.
articles.titleJa: トランプ政権下の米墨国境での生活

articles.title: At COP30, civil society stepped into real, not symbolic, leadership
articles.snippet: After several conferences shaped by restrictions and tensions between governments and social movements, this COP had active voices in the discussions from grassroots organizations, Indigenous peoples, and traditional communities.
articles.titleJa: COP30で市民社会が象徴的ではない真のリーダーシップを発揮

articles.title: ‘Femicide does not start on the day of the crime’: A Brazilian researcher’s view on gender violence in her country
articles.snippet: [Femicide] starts when psychological violence is minimized, when a partner’s control is normalized as jealousy, when jokes or demeaning comments about women are seen as humor.
articles.titleJa: 「女性殺しは犯行の日から始まるのではない」：ブラジル人研究者が語る自国のジェンダー暴力

articles.title: Trump says 'very dangerous' for UK to do business with China as Starmer lands in Shanghai
articles.snippet: The US president's comments come as Sir Keir Starmer arrives in Shanghai on the third day of his visit to China.
articles.titleJa: トランプ氏、スターマー氏が上海に到着する中、英国が中国とビジネスをするのは「非常に危険」と発言

articles.title: This tiny Australian town is up for sale - but the locals don't want to leave
articles.snippet: Residents say the sale of Licola - population, five - jeopardises its future.
articles.titleJa: この小さなオーストラリアの町が売りに出されているが、地元住民は離れたがらない

articles.title: Vietnam to sell tycoon's Hermès Birkin bags to offset fraud losses
articles.snippet: Lan had tried to hold on the bags, saying she wanted to leave them as "keepsakes" for her children.
articles.titleJa: ベトナム、詐欺による損失を相殺するため大富豪のエルメス・バーキンバッグを売却へ

articles.title: Man who exposed human rights abuses in China granted US asylum

articles.titleJa: 中国での人権侵害を暴露した男性、米国で亡命を許可される

articles.title: Watch: CCTV captures moment mayor hit in rocket launcher attack in the Philippines
articles.snippet: A mayor in the Philippines has survived a rocket launcher attack on his vehicle in broad daylight.
articles.titleJa: 動画：フィリピンで市長がロケットランチャー攻撃を受ける瞬間をCCTVが捉える

articles.title: Indians pay tribute after Arijit Singh retires at 38 as Bollywood singer
articles.snippet: Singh has been one of the most loved and recognisable voices of Bollywood for more than a decade.
articles.titleJa: ボリウッド歌手アリジット・シンが38歳で引退後、インド人が追悼の意を表す

articles.title: Big challenges lurk behind India's world-beating growth

articles.titleJa: インドの世界トップ級の成長の裏には大きな課題が潜む

articles.title: Imran Khan not the only one silenced as Pakistan military stifles dissent

articles.titleJa: パキスタン軍が反対意見を抑圧する中、沈黙させられているのはイムラン・カーンだけではない

articles.titleJa: 中国が英国の訪問をより大きなものの一部と見なす理由

articles.title: The politician whose death leaves a vacuum in India's richest state
